page.title: 01Introduction
page.content: This is a very rural area .There are small residential settlements at Cockshoot and Jack's Green in the N.W.and at The Camp in the N.E.but the area is mostly covered by farmland and forestry with only a thin scattering of farmhouses and dwellings.Minor roads serve the periphery of this block but no roads pass through its 'heart'which is the valley of Dillay Brook. The brook runs from the N.E.to the S.W.and is joined by several small streams.The valley sides are cut steeply into the Cotswold Hills and are mostly forested but the gentle slopes of the valley bottom are used as pasture. Besides this valley and the head of the Slad Valley(which lies to the N.W.)the land is high and flat-typical of Cotswold escarpment dip-slopes.
